TITLE: Apollo del Belvedere
ATTRIBUTION: Roman statue copy after a Greek bronze original attributed to Leochares
CREATION DATE: II century AD (Greek original ca. IV century BC)
DESCRIPTION: Apollo del Belvedere, Roman copy of a Greek statue.
SUBJECTS: Apollo, quiver, arrows and cloak; ideal beauty, dynamic posture, harmonious nude body.
CONTENT: The statue depicts the Greek god Apollo just after releasing an arrow, standing in an elegant, natural pose with his body slightly tilted and his gaze directed upward, embodying classical perfection and the ideal of beauty.
